title: Breach of software maker used to backdoor as many as 200,000 servers
description: Hack of FishPig distribution server used to install Rekoobe on customer systems.

title: US officially added to WHO’s list of poliovirus outbreak countries
description: The list includes mainly low- and middle-income countries, plus Israel and the UK.

title: Device passively registers temperature, switches from heating to cooling
description: When it gets too hot, it unrolls a reflective material to block absorption of light.

title: Twitter shareholders approve the $44B merger Musk is trying to get out of
description: Musk wants out, but shareholders approve $54.20-per-share purchase agreement.

title: Who said sedans were dead? The 2023 Genesis G80 Electrified, tested
description: With up to 3.9 miles/kWh, vehicle-to-load, and very fast charging, there's a lot to like.

title: Google spinoff Aalyria salvages Project Loon technology for the US military
description: Loon's laser communications and networking software get new life as Aalyria.

title: What If? 2 is here with even more serious answers to your weird questions
description: Ars chats with xkcd creator Randall Munroe about his new book, What If? 2.

title: To defeat FTC lawsuit, Meta demands 100+ rivals share biggest trade secrets
description: Snap claims Meta wants “to reconstruct virtually every decision Snap has made.”

title: Tiny robots made of “galinstan” can run faster than a (scaled down) cheetah
description: Most soft robots are slow, but these feel the need for speed.

title: Raspberry Pi OS improves menus, networking, camera possibilities
description: Setting up Wi-Fi, and using a camera for all kinds of projects, both get better.

title: Nintendo announces a boatload of classic game ports, Japanese RPGs for Switch
description: A new Fire Emblem and an anime-inspired rhythm boxing game feature.

title: Artist uses AI to extract color palettes from text descriptions
description: New technique uses an image synthesis model and some JavaScript to work its magic.

title: Senators blast Twitter’s alleged security failures as whistleblower testifies
description: Peiter Zatko testifies, and senators have a list of questions for Twitter CEO.

title: Amazon’s new Kindle offers twice the storage, a sharper screen, and USB-C for $100
description: It's $10 more expensive than it used to be, but the improvements are worth it.

title: GoldenEye 007 re-release finally confirmed—but it’s not the leaked remake
description: Good news for game preservationists, perhaps not for fans of the leaked remake.

title: The mystery of why some people don’t catch COVID
description: Scientists think they might hold the key to helping protect us all.

title: Zelda: Breath of the Wild sequel gets official name, May 2023 release date
description: Tears of the Kingdom teaser shows open-world gliding, lots of climbing.

title: Thunderbolt hits 80Gbps in demo, equaling USB4 Version 2.0 speeds
description: Intel hasn't disclosed when we'll see this kind of performance in products.

title: Is your gas stove bad for your health?
description: A growing body of research suggests that gas stoves can pose health risks.

title: A common virus is surging—and it can cause a polio-like disease in kids
description: The rare AFM has peaked in 2-year cycles. But it missed its last cycle amid COVID.

title: As summer turns to fall, ULA still waiting for its BE-4 rocket engines
description: "Why, Mr. Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles."
